0.Pros: You get to work with other people and make great friends.
0.Cons: The mangers are mean to you and very hard on you if you don't do the job fast enough for them.

1.Pros: Worked here for over 4 years some co workers become like family.Get promoted to management make $1.53 more .Learn to be strong because your basically on your own with 5 new people everyday.Get no recognition for the slave work you do.Get persuaded into giving up your availability without knowledge.
1.Cons: No team workIt's every man for themselves when it comes to managementGet written up for helping out after asked to stay longer (overtime)

2.Pros: I learned so much about myself through working there
2.Cons: They will over work you if you let them

3.Pros: good amount of hours, flexible schedule
3.Cons: not enough of flexibility to go back to school

4.Pros: Your coworkers will be the light in the darkness, free food, nice "usual" customers, will teach you how to multitask and use time effectively
4.Cons: Can be very stressful, low wage, work environment needs improvement, more/better training needed

5.Pros: Free food on your lunch break

6.Pros: Good service and everyone is nice
6.Cons: The hours are to little for me

8.Pros: The training and benefits are actually pretty decent. The training is business training and you can get college credit for it.
8.Cons: Challenging changes. Sometimes changes in protocol can change the efficiency of the Store. Especially true when managing a younger generation.

9.Pros: Working with th3 public is always a plus for me. I love to make people HAPPY with the great McDonald's food.
9.Cons: Standing on your feet all day. Sometimes working long hours. It seems like everyday there is a disgruntled customer for whatever reason
